content: Call to Repent
Now on that very occasion there were some present who reported to Him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
And Jesus responded and said to them,
And He  telling this parable:
Healing on the Sabbath
Now  was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
And there was a woman who for eighteen years had had a sickness caused by a spirit; and she was bent over double, and could not straighten up at all.
When Jesus saw her, He called her over and said to her,
And He laid His hands on her; and immediately she stood up straight again, and  glorifying God.

But the synagogue leader, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath,  saying to the crowd in response, “There are six days during which work should be done; so come during them and get healed, and not on the Sabbath day.”
But the Lord answered him and said,
And as He said this, all His opponents were being humiliated; and the entire crowd was rejoicing over all the glorious things being done by Him.
Parables of Mustard Seed and Leaven
So He was saying,
And again He said,
Teaching in the Villages
And He was passing through one city and village after another, teaching, and proceeding on His way to Jerusalem.
And someone said to Him, “Lord, are there  a few who are being saved?” And He said to them,
At that very time some Pharisees approached, saying to Him, “Go away and leave this place, because Herod wants to kill You.”
And He said to them,
